titles.title: A concurrent resolution to express the sense of the Congress concerning tourist travel to South Africa by United States citizens.

action.text: Referred to House Committee on Foreign Affairs.
Referred to Subcommittee on International Economic Policy and Trade.

bill.summary: 7/22/1987--Introduced. Declares that citizens and residents of the United States, including performers and entertainers, and United States-based groups or organizations should refrain from any tourist or convention travel to South Africa until the termination of the apartheid system of government in South Africa.
